titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Founded January 23, 1890, at 1624 Arch Street by Spencer Trotter, William L. Baily, J. Harris Reed, George S. Morris and Samuel N. Rhoads, the Delaware Valley Ornithological Club has flourished ever since. Through most of its existence its headquarters have been at the Academy of Natural Sciences and its collections eventually were donated to that institution. Its official organ is "Cassinia," where much of historic and biographical interest to ornithologists has been published.

scopecontent.p: The collection includes: Spring roundups (annual bird counts), 1933, 1940-1991; DVOC newsletters (Larus), 1950-1996 (incomplete); minutes of the DVOC, 1976-1988; membership list from the 1990s; financial reports, 1990-1994; photographs and slides of DVOC activities and members; video of a 1925 trip to the Pine Barrens; audiocassette with an interview of George Reynard; a copy of the constitution of the DVOC; and a small amount of correspondence. There are also two binders containing correspondence and artwork from the Julian Potter collection: letters to Potter from Witmer Stone (1916-1937), programs and newsletters, and program booklets from the Ludwick Lecture Series (1926-1943, not all years represented); heavily illustrated letters, postcards, and Christmas cards from Conrad Roland (1918-1955); and biographical information and a CD of the two Julian Potter binders.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia Ornithology Department records, C. Chandler Ross papers, Stephen T. Harty papers, Delaware Valley Ornithological Club papers (collection 74), and Delaware Valley Ornithological Club scrapbook (collection 570).
